Clear, systematic separation of factual and legal uncertainty

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Neutrality and Interpretive Bias
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Assesses whether the summary uses neutral, descriptive language appropriate for dataset-building, or whether it contains subjective, persuasive, or party-favoring wording that could bias downstream models; includes attribution of interpretive statements.

sub_criteria.name: Objective vs. Subjective Language
sub_criteria.description: Degree to which wording is neutral/descriptive versus subjective or advocacy-laden.
accepted_values: Mostly neutral with occasional subjective phrasing

sub_criteria.name: Framing Bias (leading statements)
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary frames issues in leading ways that emphasize one party's narrative or a particular interpretation.
accepted_values: Balanced presentation with no leading framing

sub_criteria.name: Attribution of Interpretations
sub_criteria.description: Whether interpretive statements are attributed to parties/briefs/judgment rather than presented as unqualified facts.
accepted_values: Interpretations presented as facts without attribution
Occasional attribution but many unattributed claims

sub_criteria.name: Use of Hedging and Certainty Markers
sub_criteria.description: Whether hedging terms are used appropriately for contested or uncertain material and certainty is not overstated.
accepted_values: Hedging used appropriately in most cases
Robust and appropriate use of hedging/uncertainty markers

sub_criteria.name: Bias Metrics Provided
sub_criteria.description: Whether any bias-detection metrics, neutrality scores, or reviewer notes are included to quantify or flag interpretive bias.
accepted_values: Some quantitative metrics but limited coverage
Comprehensive bias/neutrality metrics and reviewer provenance

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Internal Consistency and Logical Coherence
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Checks the summary for internal contradictions, mismatched outcomes and reasoning, incoherent sequences, or citation-claim mismatches that would reduce reliability for model training or analysis.

sub_criteria.name: Outcome-Reasoning Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Whether the stated holding/disposition follows logically from the summarized reasoning and cited authority.
accepted_values: Direct contradictions between holding and reasoning
Holding and reasoning fully consistent and logically connected

sub_criteria.name: Factual Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Checks for contradictory factual statements within the summary (e.g., multiple dates for the same event).

sub_criteria.name: Sequence and Temporal Coherence
sub_criteria.description: Whether events and procedural steps are presented in a coherent order that aligns with metadata dates.
accepted_values: Clear, chronological, and temporally coherent presentation

sub_criteria.name: Citation-to-Claim Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Whether citations provided support the claims to which they are attached (no mismatched or irrelevant citations).
accepted_values: Frequent mismatches between claims and citations

sub_criteria.name: Numeric / Monetary Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Whether monetary amounts, percentages, or numeric metrics are consistent across sections (e.g., damages amount repeated consistently).
accepted_values: Numeric values consistent and reconciled across document

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Argumentation and Reasoning Extractability
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Measures whether the summary exposes the legal tests/standards applied, element-level findings, and traceable inferential steps necessary to extract structured reasoning features for modeling.

sub_criteria.name: Test/Standard Identification
sub_criteria.description: Whether the legal tests, standards, statutory elements, or precedents applied are explicitly named and described.
accepted_values: Tests named but not fully specified
Tests and standards explicitly named and defined

sub_criteria.name: Element-level Findings
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary indicates which elements of a legal test were satisfied or not and provides the supporting factual basis.
accepted_values: Some elements discussed but unclear satisfaction status
Complete element-by-element findings with evidence linkage

sub_criteria.name: Inference/Step Traceability
sub_criteria.description: Whether the inferential steps (how the court moved from facts to law to conclusion) are delineated so they can be programmatically traced.
accepted_values: Most major steps traceable with some gaps
All key inferential steps explicit and traceable

sub_criteria.name: Counterargument and Distinction Capture
sub_criteria.description: Whether counterarguments, dissenting points, or distinguishing factors are captured to enable richer feature extraction.
accepted_values: Comprehensive capture of counterarguments and distinctions

sub_criteria.name: Precedent Treatment and Weighting
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary identifies key precedents, explains how they were used (binding, persuasive), and indicates the weight given to them.
accepted_values: Precedents identified with partial explanation of role
Precedents clearly identified with explicit treatment and weighting

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Conciseness, Information Density and Readability
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Evaluates whether the summary balances brevity and informativeness: concise enough for efficient processing while containing the signals needed for modeling. Also checks readability for rapid human inspection.

sub_criteria.name: Length Appropriateness
sub_criteria.description: Whether summary length is appropriate for intended analytic use (triage vs. feature-rich input).
accepted_values: Concise but sometimes omits details needed for analysis

sub_criteria.name: Signal-to-Noise Ratio
sub_criteria.description: Proportion of text containing actionable legal signal versus background or irrelevant content.

sub_criteria.name: Redundancy and Repetition
sub_criteria.description: Extent of unnecessary repetition that reduces effective information density for automated models.

sub_criteria.name: Readability and Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Whether the writing is clear, well-structured and uses language appropriate for legal-data consumers (researchers and NLP systems).
accepted_values: Highly readable and clear for target audience

sub_criteria.name: Executive Summary / TL;DR Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether a very short executive summary is provided that distills the core outcome and most salient signals for rapid triage.
accepted_values: Concise executive summary present covering key points
High-quality TL;DR capturing outcome, issues, and remedy

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Provenance, Versioning and Reproducibility Metadata
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Assess whether the summary records enough provenance information (source document ID, summarizer type and ID, extraction timestamp, version) to support reproducible dataset construction and experiments.

sub_criteria.name: Source Identification
sub_criteria.description: Whether the original source document (file ID, docket ID or other stable reference) is recorded to allow re-checking against the primary text.
accepted_values: Source referenced but not with stable ID

sub_criteria.name: Summarizer Attribution
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary records how it was produced (human analyst, automated system, version of model/tool) and identifier for the creator.
accepted_values: Detailed summarizer attribution (human/automated, tool/model version, annotator ID)

sub_criteria.name: Extraction Timestamp and Versioning
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary records a timestamp and a version identifier so downstream users can reproduce or track changes.
accepted_values: Standardized timestamp and stable version ID

sub_criteria.name: Data Licensing / Use Constraints (embedded)
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary includes machine-readable statements about licensing or permitted uses that affect dataset reuse (simple label, not external validation).

sub_criteria.name: Change Log / Edit History
sub_criteria.description: Whether the document records edits, rationale for changes, and who made them to enable reproducible dataset curation.
accepted_values: Comprehensive change log with authorship and timestamps
